subheaderText: A self-referential guide to a not-so complicated problem

extraTabs.name: Extra Tab(s)
extraTabs.content:
All instances use the first two tabs for the outline and action pyramid.

You can add an arbitrary number of additional tabs and content in your data file.
> ```
>"extraTabs":
> [
>  {
>    "icon": "◨",
>    "name": "Extra Tab(s)"
>    "content": "All instances use the first two tabs...",
>  },
>  ...
>]


Content can be formatted using [Github Flavored Markdown](https://github.github.com/gfm/)

root.text: It's difficult to effectively communicate practical information about complicated subjects.

children.text: Your intended audience is (probably) a human and all humans are conflicted. One minute, insisting __"Just tell me what to do!"__ The next minute, protesting __"Hold up! That doesn't make sense to me."__

Were we self-aware, we'd say: __"Just tell me what I need to do as long as it already perfectly aligns with my understanding of the subject, which is obviously fatally flawed, since if it wasn't, I wouldn't need to be told what to do."__
Accept that your audience needs both practical, prioritized actions AND a framework of concepts that explain and support those actions.

root.text: Using this software can make it easier.

children.text: It is a system for organizing complex subjects into a hierarchy of concepts, clarifications, references and ultimately practical actions. It also handily extracts those actions into a "Pyramid" (actually it's closer to a Ziggurat) so people can "just be told what to do"
The primary organizational blocks are "Concepts", "Actions" and "Clarifications".
Actions are pithy, clear and practical.
Order the actions that you want your audience to implement.

The software will automatically extract your actions into a hierarchy. However, you can override this default behavior by providing and explicit level value.

```
{
  "id": ####,
  "type": "action",
  "text": "..."
  "level": 2
}
```
One or more _concepts_ lead to and undergird an action.
Working from general to specific, organize concepts that support and lead to your actions.
Clarifications provide additional details and context to flesh out the action.
Write clarifications to address the obvious misinterpretations of the action.
Upload your data file and add its URI to your environmnet variables.
